content.1: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
content.2: If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die,
content.3: If the sun be risen upon him,
content.4: If the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.
content.5: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man’s field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.
content.6: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed
content.7: If a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man’s house; if the thief be found, let him pay double.
content.8: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges,
content.10: If a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing
content.12: And if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
content.13: If it be torn in pieces,
content.16: And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.
content.17: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
content.18: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
content.19: Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
content.21: Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
content.22: Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
content.23: If thou afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
content.24: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
content.26: If thou at all take thy neighbour’s raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him by that the sun goeth down:
content.28: Thou shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people.
content.30: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen,
content.31: And ye shall be holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat
